pullRequest.body:
Copy some explanations from other comments into the actual `ring_nf` docstring. Add details to `ring` docstring.

---

PR is merged. Please leave a blank newline before the `---`, otherwise
GitHub will format the text above it as a title.

For details on the "pull request lifecycle" in mathlib, please see:
https://leanprover-community.github.io/contribute/index.html

In particular, note that most reviewers will only notice your PR
if it passes the continuous integration checks.
Please ask for help on https://leanprover.zulipchat.com if needed.

To indicate co-authors, include lines at the bottom of the commit message
(that is, before the `---`) using the following format:

Co-authored-by: Author Name <author@email.com>

If you are moving or deleting declarations, please include these lines at the bottom of the commit message
(that is, before the `---`) using the following format:

Moves:
- Vector.* -> Mathlib.Vector.*
- ...

Deletions:
- Nat.bit1_add_bit1
- ...

Any other comments you want to keep out of the PR commit should go
below the `---`, and placed outside this HTML comment, or else they
will be invisible to reviewers.

If this PR depends on other PRs, please list them below this comment,
using the following format:

- [ ] depends on: #xyz [optional extra text]

#### Import changes for modified files

No significant changes to the import graph


<details><summary>Import changes for all files</summary>

|Files|Import difference|
|-|-|

</details>

---

#### Declarations diff

No declarations were harmed in the making of this PR! üêô
<details>
  <summary>You can run this locally as follows</summary>


```bash
## summary with just the declaration names:
./scripts/declarations_diff.sh <optional_commit>

## more verbose report:
./scripts/declarations_diff.sh long <optional_commit>
```
</details>

The doc-module for `script/declarations_diff.sh` contains some details about this script.

Looks good to me.

maintainer merge
üöÄ Pull request has been placed on the maintainer queue by joneugster.

Pull request successfully merged into master.

Build succeeded:
  * [Build](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/actions/runs/10393756679/job/28781968314)
  * [Lint style](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/actions/runs/10393756679/job/28781969083)

What's the referent of "This" here? It doesn't seem like it is the `ring` tactic, since the following sentence says it can be used to prove things that `ring` cannot.

Since this text was copied from the module docstring, maybe it applies to `ring_nf` instead? But the module docstring is also confusing to me since it states that `ring_nf` uses `ring`, but as far as I can tell, it's actually the other way around?

cc: @digama0
I agree. There should be some fixes. Let's use this PR for it.
Okay, moved the paragraph to the `ring_nf` docstring. Thanks.

@bryangingechen `ring_nf` uses `ring` infrastructurally (`ring_nf` is the more complicated tactic, built on `ring`), but it also installs itself as a hook to `ring` so that `ring` will try `ring_nf` on failure and suggest that.

Speaking for myself, I'm not sure this addition actually clarifies anything. (I have a reasonable intuition for what `ring` does, but don't have a clue about `ring1`.) I'm not blocking this PR, but please think about whether this is the most useful thing to show users?
the user-level explanation of `ring1`  is: it's `ring`, but it fails instead of trying and suggesting `ring_nf` if the goal is not appropriate for `ring`.
Changed accordingly and added example. I think it's good to have, as I myself was puzzled for a long time by the `ring_nf` suggestion.

pullRequest.title: [Merged by Bors] - doc(Tactic): expand `ring` and `ring_nf` docstrings
